course: DSA01 – Object Oriented Programming with C++

questions.title: Shape Properties (Virtual Functions)
questions.question_statement: Create a Shape base class with virtual functions for area(), perimeter(), and print(). Implement derived classes for Circle, Rectangle, and Triangle [7-9].
questions.solution_explanation: Use virtual methods in C++ to allow polymorphic behavior across different shape types.

questions.title: University Management System
questions.question_statement: Design a system using classes for Person, Student, Professor, and Course. Include functionality for enrollment and teaching assignments [10-13].
questions.sample_output: John is teaching CS101 - Intro to CS
questions.solution_explanation: Implement class associations where Course objects maintain vectors of Student pointers.

questions.title: Employee Bonus Calculation
questions.question_statement: Calculate a 5% bonus for grade A and 10% for grade B. Add an extra 2% if the salary is below 10,000 [14, 15].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply conditional checks for the grade and an independent check for the low-salary threshold.

questions.title: Basic Arithmetic Operations
questions.question_statement: Perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division on two integers [15, 16].
questions.solution_explanation: Use standard arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /).

questions.title: Interest Calculator
questions.question_statement: Calculate Simple Interest and Compound Interest based on principal, rate, and time [16, 17].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply the standard mathematical formulas for SI and CI.

questions.title: Temperature Conversion
questions.question_statement: Convert temperature from Celsius to Fahrenheit [17, 18].
questions.solution_explanation: Formula: F = (C * 9/5) + 32.

questions.title: Odd or Even Check
questions.question_statement: Determine if a given integer is odd or even [19, 20].
questions.solution_explanation: Use the modulus operator (%) to check if the remainder is zero when divided by 2.

questions.title: Greater of Two Numbers
questions.question_statement: Accept two numbers and print which one is greater [19, 21].
questions.solution_explanation: A simple if-else condition handles the comparison.

questions.title: Factorial (Iterative)
questions.question_statement: Find the factorial of a given number using a loop [1, 22].
questions.solution_explanation: Loop from 1 to N, maintaining a product.

questions.title: Prime Number Check
questions.question_statement: Determine whether a given number is a prime number [1, 4, 23].
questions.solution_explanation: Check for divisors between 2 and half of the number.

questions.title: Fibonacci Series
questions.question_statement: Generate the Fibonacci series up to N terms [23-25].
questions.solution_explanation: Iteratively calculate each term by adding the two previous terms.

questions.title: Palindrome Number Check
questions.question_statement: Check if a number is a palindrome [24, 26].
questions.solution_explanation: Reverse the digits and compare the result with the original value.

questions.title: Armstrong Number
questions.question_statement: Determine if a three-digit integer is an Armstrong number [27, 28].
questions.solution_explanation: The sum of the cubes of its digits must equal the number.

questions.title: String to Uppercase
questions.question_statement: Convert a given string to uppercase using standard transformations [29, 30].
questions.solution_explanation: Use transform() with ::toupper in C++.

questions.title: Average of Three Numbers
questions.question_statement: Calculate the average of three given integers [29, 31, 32].
questions.solution_explanation: Sum the values and divide by 3.0.

questions.title: Divisibility by 3 (Ternary)
questions.question_statement: Use a ternary operator to check if an integer is divisible by 3 [31, 33].
questions.solution_explanation: Condition ? result1 : result2.

questions.title: Sequential Printing
questions.question_statement: Print numbers from 1 to 10 using a for loop [34, 35].
questions.solution_explanation: A basic for loop starting from 1 to 10.

questions.title: Multiplication Table
questions.question_statement: Print the multiplication table for a specific number [34, 36, 37].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate from 1 to 10 and multiply with the input number.

questions.title: Sum of Digits
questions.question_statement: Calculate the sum of the digits of a given number [36, 38, 39].
questions.solution_explanation: Extract digits using modulus 10 and sum them.

questions.title: Equality Check
questions.question_statement: Compare two integers to see if they are equal [38, 40, 41].
questions.solution_explanation: Use the equality operator (==).

questions.title: Floating-point Arithmetic
questions.question_statement: Perform arithmetic operations including modulus on floating-point numbers [40, 42, 43].
questions.solution_explanation: Use std::fmod for calculating the remainder of doubles.

questions.title: Vowel or Consonant Check
questions.question_statement: Determine if a character is a vowel, consonant, or an invalid alphabet [42, 44, 45].
questions.solution_explanation: Check against a predefined set of vowels (a, e, i, o, u).

questions.title: Number Sign Check
questions.question_statement: Determine if a number is positive, negative, or zero [44, 46].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested if-else statements.

questions.title: Rounding (Floor/Ceil)
questions.question_statement: Round a floating-point number down (floor) and up (ceil) [46-48].
questions.solution_explanation: Utilize floor() and ceil() functions from the math library.

questions.title: Swapping with XOR
questions.question_statement: Swap two variables using the XOR bitwise operator [47, 49].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply the property that x ^ x = 0.

questions.title: Largest of Three (Ternary)
questions.question_statement: Find the largest of three integers using ternary operators [49, 50].
questions.solution_explanation: Nest two ternary expressions to compare all three values.

questions.title: Greatest Common Divisor (GCD)
questions.question_statement: Find the GCD of two numbers using loops [51-53].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate from 1 to the minimum of the two numbers.

questions.title: Narcissistic Number
questions.question_statement: Check if an integer is a narcissistic number (sum of digits raised to power of count) [54, 55].
questions.solution_explanation: Count digits N, then sum (digit^N).

questions.title: Hollow Triangle Pattern
questions.question_statement: Print a hollow triangle star pattern with 6 rows [55, 56].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested loops and conditional checks for boundaries.

questions.title: Pascal's Triangle
questions.question_statement: Generate N rows of Pascal's triangle [56, 57].
questions.solution_explanation: Calculate each row element using binomial coefficients.

questions.title: Diamond Pattern
questions.question_statement: Print a diamond pattern of stars [57-59].
questions.solution_explanation: Combine upper and lower symmetric triangle patterns.

questions.title: Perfect Number Check
questions.question_statement: Determine if a number is a perfect number [58, 60, 61].
questions.solution_explanation: A perfect number equals the sum of its proper divisors.

questions.title: Harshad Number
questions.question_statement: Check if a number is divisible by the sum of its digits [62-64].
questions.solution_explanation: Calculate digit sum and perform divisibility check.

questions.title: Happy Number Check
questions.question_statement: Determine if a number is a Happy Number [65-68].
questions.solution_explanation: Sum of squares of digits must eventually reach 1.

questions.title: Strong Number
questions.question_statement: Check if a number is a Strong number (sum of factorials of digits) [69, 70].
questions.solution_explanation: Pre-calculate factorials of digits 0-9 for efficiency.

questions.title: Buzz Number
questions.question_statement: Check if a number is divisible by 7 or ends with 7 [70, 71].

questions.title: Neon Number
questions.question_statement: Determine if the sum of digits of the square of a number equals the number [71, 72].
questions.solution_explanation: Calculate square, then sum digits of the square.

questions.title: Abundant Number
questions.question_statement: Check if the sum of proper divisors is greater than the number [72, 73].
questions.solution_explanation: Proper divisors of 12 (1, 2, 3, 4, 6) sum to 16, which is > 12.

questions.title: Number Pattern (Rows)
questions.question_statement: Print a triangle pattern where each row contains its row index [73-75].
questions.solution_explanation: Outer loop rows, inner loop prints 'i' count.

questions.title: Reverse an Array
questions.question_statement: Reverse the elements of an integer array [74, 76, 77].
questions.solution_explanation: Use two-pointer swap method or a temporary array.

questions.title: Matrix Addition (3x3)
questions.question_statement: Perform element-wise addition of two 3x3 matrices [77-79].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested loops to traverse rows and columns.

questions.title: Matrix Multiplication
questions.question_statement: Multiply two matrices after validating their dimensions [80-82].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply the dot product rule using three nested loops.

questions.title: Matrix Diagonal Sum
questions.question_statement: Calculate the sum of both the primary and secondary diagonals [83-85].
questions.solution_explanation: Primary: row == col; Secondary: row + col == n - 1.

questions.title: Insert into Array
questions.question_statement: Insert an element at a specific index in an array [86, 87].
questions.solution_explanation: Shift subsequent elements to the right before insertion.

questions.title: Delete from Array
questions.question_statement: Delete an element from a specific index in an array [87-89].
questions.solution_explanation: Shift subsequent elements to the left after deletion.

questions.title: Sum of Array Elements
questions.question_statement: Calculate the total sum of array elements [90-92].
questions.solution_explanation: Accumulate elements in a sum variable using a loop.

questions.title: Average of Array
questions.question_statement: Find the average value of elements in an array [93-95].
questions.solution_explanation: Divide the array sum by its length.

questions.title: Second Largest Element
questions.question_statement: Find the second largest integer in an array [96, 97].
questions.solution_explanation: Maintain max and second-max variables while iterating once.

questions.title: Value Frequency
questions.question_statement: Count the number of times a specific value appears in an array [98, 99].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate through the array and increment a counter on matches.

questions.title: Merge Sorted Arrays
questions.question_statement: Merge two pre-sorted arrays into a single sorted array [99-101].
questions.solution_explanation: Compare elements from both arrays and insert the smaller one sequentially.

questions.title: Dynamic Array Allocation
questions.question_statement: Use pointers to allocate and display a dynamic array [101-103].
questions.solution_explanation: Use new[] and delete[] operators to manage heap memory.

questions.title: Recursive Factorial
questions.question_statement: Calculate the factorial of a number using recursion [2, 102].
questions.solution_explanation: Implement base case (n=0) and recursive call (n * fact(n-1)).

questions.title: Call-by-Value vs Reference
questions.question_statement: Demonstrate the difference between swapping values using value vs reference [104-107].
questions.solution_explanation: Call-by-value creates a copy; call-by-reference operates on the original memory.

questions.title: Voting Eligibility
questions.question_statement: Check if a user is eligible to vote (age >= 18) [108-110].
questions.solution_explanation: Simple age comparison with logic for remaining years.

questions.title: Variable Addresses
questions.question_statement: Print the memory addresses of various variable types [108, 111-113].
questions.solution_explanation: Use the address-of operator (&) for each variable.

questions.title: Square Calculation (Inline)
questions.question_statement: Calculate the square of a number using regular and inline functions [111, 114].
questions.solution_explanation: Demonstrate the 'inline' keyword for potential optimization.

questions.title: Student Grading Class
questions.question_statement: Define a Student class to calculate average score and assign letter grades [114-117].
questions.solution_explanation: Encapsulate data and use if-else logic within a class method.

questions.title: Number Comparison Class
questions.question_statement: Create a class with methods to read and compare two integers [41, 118].
questions.solution_explanation: Practice basic class-member function structure.

questions.title: Employee Bonus Class
questions.question_statement: Define an Employee class with a constructor and display function for salary data [119, 120].
questions.solution_explanation: Use constructors to initialize object state.

questions.title: Nth Bit Operations
questions.question_statement: Set or check the Nth bit of a given integer [121-124].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply bitwise shift (1 << n) and OR/AND operators.

questions.title: Most Frequent Element
questions.question_statement: Find the element that appears most often in an array [125-128].
questions.solution_explanation: Use frequency counting or hashing to find the mode.

questions.title: Power Calculation
questions.question_statement: Calculate the power of a number (base^exponent) [129-131].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterative multiplication or usage of pow() function.

questions.title: Integer Square Root
questions.question_statement: Find the integer square root of a number without library functions [132].
questions.solution_explanation: Loop from 0 up to n/2 to find where i*i == n.

questions.title: Integer Cube Root
questions.question_statement: Find the integer cube root of a given number [60, 133-135].
questions.solution_explanation: Iteratively check i*i*i until it matches or exceeds n.

questions.title: Sum of Natural Numbers
questions.question_statement: Calculate the sum of the first N natural numbers using while and do-while loops [136-138].
questions.solution_explanation: Practice different loop structures for a common summation task.

questions.title: Complex Number Overloading
questions.question_statement: Overload + and - operators for complex number arithmetic [139-144].
questions.solution_explanation: Define operator methods within a class to handle custom data structures.

questions.title: Income Tax Calculator
questions.question_statement: Calculate income tax based on brackets: 60k(0%), 150k(5%), 500k(10%), above(15%) [141, 144-146].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a series of if-else-if statements to identify the tax tier.

questions.title: Constructor Overloading (Area)
questions.question_statement: Calculate the area of a circle, rectangle, and triangle using overloaded constructors [145, 147-151].
questions.solution_explanation: Define multiple constructors with different parameter signatures.

questions.title: Volume of 3D Objects
questions.question_statement: Overload constructors to calculate volumes of cubes and cylinders [152-155].
questions.solution_explanation: Differentiate between single-param (cube) and double-param (cylinder) constructors.

questions.title: Floyd's Triangle
questions.question_statement: Print N rows of Floyd's triangle using a constructor/destructor pattern [156-158].
questions.solution_explanation: A running counter is printed in rows of increasing width.

questions.title: Decimal to Binary
questions.question_statement: Convert a decimal integer to its binary equivalent [159-162].
questions.solution_explanation: Successive division by 2 and collecting remainders.

questions.title: Private Inheritance
questions.question_statement: Demonstrate private inheritance and visibility of protected members [163-165].
questions.solution_explanation: Private inheritance makes public/protected members of the base class private in the derived class.

questions.title: Multiple Inheritance Sum
questions.question_statement: Calculate sum by inheriting values from two independent base classes [165-169].
questions.solution_explanation: Derived class inherits from Base1 and Base2 simultaneously.

questions.title: Polymorphic Area Calculation
questions.question_statement: Use pure virtual functions to calculate area for Square and Circle [112, 170, 171].
questions.solution_explanation: Abstract base class Shape defines a virtual area() interface.

questions.title: The 'this' Pointer
questions.question_statement: Display a variable value using the 'this' pointer [113, 171].
questions.solution_explanation: Use 'this->x' to distinguish member variables from parameters.

questions.title: Array/Pointer Addresses
questions.question_statement: Print element addresses using both array indexing and pointer arithmetic [92, 113, 167, 172].
questions.solution_explanation: Show how *(ptr + i) corresponds to arr[i].

questions.title: Bank Management System
questions.question_statement: Implement a full bank system with deposits, withdrawals, and balance inquiries via inheritance [173-179].
questions.solution_explanation: Inherit Customer and Account details into a central Bank class.

questions.title: Student Report Generator
questions.question_statement: Generate a final report with marks and percentages using inheritance [180-184].
questions.solution_explanation: Calculate student statistics by inheriting from a core Student class.

questions.title: Net Salary Calculation
questions.question_statement: Calculate Net Salary by deducting taxes from Gross Salary using multilevel inheritance [183, 185-188].
questions.solution_explanation: Chain classes: Employee -> GrossSalary -> NetSalary.

questions.title: Infinite Sorting
questions.question_statement: Sort an infinite list of input numbers until -1 is entered [186, 189].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a dynamic container like std::vector and sort() algorithm.

questions.title: Patient-Doctor Records
questions.question_statement: Manage medical records by linking patients to specific doctors [153, 189-191].
questions.solution_explanation: Associate Patient data with Doctor details through class inheritance.

questions.title: Username Validation
questions.question_statement: Check if a re-entered username matches the original entry [109, 192].
questions.solution_explanation: Simple string equality comparison.

questions.title: Senior Citizen Interest
questions.question_statement: Apply 10% interest for senior citizens and 12% for others [193].
questions.solution_explanation: Conditional interest rate application based on age input.

questions.title: Default Arguments Sum
questions.question_statement: Implement a sum function that handles up to four integers using default arguments [194].
questions.solution_explanation: Specify default values (0) in the function signature.

questions.title: Static Member Counter
questions.question_statement: Use a static variable to count how many objects of a class are created [195-197].
questions.solution_explanation: Increment a static class member within the constructor.

questions.title: Calculator via Switch
questions.question_statement: Build a menu-driven calculator for basic arithmetic using switch/case [197-202].
questions.solution_explanation: Map choices (1-5) to arithmetic operations.

questions.title: Programmer Pay Slip
questions.question_statement: Generate a detailed payslip including DA (97%), HRA (10%), and PF (12%) deductions [203-206].
questions.solution_explanation: Perform percentage-based financial calculations.

questions.title: Remove Array Duplicates
questions.question_statement: Sort an array and remove all duplicate elements [206, 207].
questions.solution_explanation: Sort the array, then use unique() and erase() algorithms.

questions.title: Mammal/Marine Animal Taxonomy
questions.question_statement: Implement a BlueWhale class inheriting from both Mammals and MarineAnimals [208, 209].
questions.solution_explanation: Demonstrate multiple inheritance hierarchy.

questions.title: Degree Hierarchy
questions.question_statement: Create classes for Undergraduate and Postgraduate inheriting from a base Degree class [148, 209].
questions.solution_explanation: Basic hierarchical inheritance demonstration.

questions.title: Physics/Math/Chem Marks
questions.question_statement: Manage subject-specific marks for a class of students [210-214].
questions.solution_explanation: Use separate subclasses for subjects inheriting from a core Marks class.

questions.title: 2x2 Matrix Add/Sub Switch
questions.question_statement: Allow user to choose between adding or subtracting 2x2 matrices [79, 214-216].
questions.solution_explanation: Matrix math within a conditional switch block.

questions.title: ASCII Character Value
questions.question_statement: Retrieve the ASCII integer value for any given character [95].
questions.solution_explanation: Typecast a char to an int to reveal its ASCII code.

questions.title: Days to YMD Conversion
questions.question_statement: Convert a total number of days into Years, Months, Weeks, and Days [134, 217].
questions.solution_explanation: Use integer division and modulus with values 365, 30, and 7.

questions.title: Cube of a Number
questions.question_statement: Calculate the third power of a number [134, 218-220].
questions.solution_explanation: Simple x * x * x multiplication.

questions.title: Decimal to Octal
questions.question_statement: Convert a decimal integer to its octal representation [162, 221].
questions.solution_explanation: Divide by 8 and collect remainders.

questions.title: LCM and GCD
questions.question_statement: Find both the Least Common Multiple and GCD of two numbers [52, 222].
questions.solution_explanation: LCM(a,b) = (a*b) / GCD(a,b).

questions.title: Leap Year Check
questions.question_statement: Determine if a year is a leap year based on Gregorian rules [222, 223].
questions.solution_explanation: Check divisibility by 4, 100, and 400.

questions.title: Min/Max in List
questions.question_statement: Find the minimum and maximum values in a given list of integers [224-226].
questions.solution_explanation: Single-pass iteration comparing each element against current bounds.

questions.title: Min/Max Sum & Sub
questions.question_statement: Calculate the sum and difference between the max and min of an array [225, 226].
questions.solution_explanation: Identify min/max first, then perform secondary arithmetic.

questions.title: Hierarchical Square/Cube
questions.question_statement: Inherit from a Number class to calculate square and cube values [227-229].
questions.solution_explanation: Common base class Number provides the input value.

questions.title: Binary Search
questions.question_statement: Search for a target value in a sorted array using binary search [120, 230].
questions.solution_explanation: Repeatedly divide the search interval in half.

questions.title: Division Exception Handling
questions.question_statement: Use try-catch blocks to handle division by zero errors [231, 232].
questions.sample_output: Exception: Division by zero not allowed!
questions.solution_explanation: Throw a runtime_error and catch it to prevent program crash.

questions.title: Unique Element (XOR)
questions.question_statement: Find the unique element in an array where every other element repeats twice [233, 234].
questions.solution_explanation: XORing all elements results in the unique value as duplicates cancel out.

questions.title: Valid Parentheses Check
questions.question_statement: Determine if a string of parentheses is valid [45, 235].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a stack to ensure every opening bracket has a matching closing bracket.

questions.title: Median of Two Arrays
questions.question_statement: Merge two arrays and find the median value of the combined list [236, 237].
questions.solution_explanation: Merge, sort, and find the middle element(s).

questions.title: Minimum Window Substring
questions.question_statement: Find the smallest window in a string that contains all characters of another string [33, 237, 238].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a sliding window approach with two pointers and a character map.

questions.title: Sum of Two Primes
questions.question_statement: Find two prime numbers that sum up to a given even integer [239, 240].
